section.title: background
section.para: The database search queries project addresses the following needs:

listitem.para: deliver search queries inside MMBase in a uniform and device-independent manner
provide mechanisms to process these queries in a device-specific way that ensures optimal performance

section.para: The plan of action for the project defines three stages:

listitem.para: Create a SearchQuery object to represent all possible search queries supported by standard relational databases.
Create an extension mechanism to enable use of additional, vendor specific, database functionality.
Integrate of the SearchQuery into existing MMBase code.

section.para: The current state of the project is that stage 1 has been completed. This article introduces the resulting SearchQuery design and implementation.

listitem.para: Sourcecode is available from CVS module speeltuin\dbsq\src.
JUnit tests sourcecode is available from CVS module speeltuin\dbsq\test\src.
UML diagrams including javadoc are available from the project website at mmbase.org.

section.title: org.mmbase.storage.search
section.para: Defines the SearchQuery interface along with all collaborating interfaces.
SearchQuery objects are essentially container objects that hold data describing query requests. The storage layer needs to retreive this data from the objects in order to process the query.
The package contains the exact interfaces available to retrieve this data from the query objects.
Note that these interfaces don't specify how query objects are constructed, see next section.

section.title: org.mmbase.storage.search.implementation
section.para: Contains classes implementing the interfaces mentioned above.
